response:
reasoning='1. Identify interior coordinates: for vertices (2,2)-(2,7)-(7,7)-(7,2) any pixel with 3≤row≤6 and 3≤col≤6 is strictly inside (edges are excluded). That yields 16 pixels arranged in a 4×4 grid.
   Coordinates & intensities:
   Row3: (3,3)=30,(3,4)=33,(3,5)=36,(3,6)=39
   Row4: (4,3)=32,(4,4)=35,(4,5)=38,(4,6)=41
   Row5: (5,3)=34,(5,4)=37,(5,5)=40,(5,6)=43
   Row6: (6,3)=36,(6,4)=39,(6,5)=42,(6,6)=45
   Intensity list = [30,33,36,39,32,35,38,41,34,37,40,43,36,39,42,45]

2. First-order statistics
   • Mean = Σx /16 = 600/16 = 37.5000
   • Sample variance = Σ(x-μ)² /(N-1) = 260/15 = 17.3333
   • Third central moment Σ(x-μ)³ cancels to 0 ⇒ Skewness = 0.0000 (any sample-correction factor still yields 0)
   • Fourth central moment Σ(x-μ)⁴ = 9377
     Sample excess kurtosis (Fisher) g₂ = [n(n+1)/( (n-1)(n-2)(n-3) )]·(Σ(x-μ)⁴ / s⁴) − [3(n-1)²/((n-2)(n-3))]  = 3.1096 − 3.7099 ≈ −0.6003

3. GLCM (offset 0,1) inside ROI
   Each interior row supplies pairs:
   (30,33),(33,36),(36,39);
   (32,35),(35,38),(38,41);
   (34,37),(37,40),(40,43);
   (36,39),(39,42),(42,45) — 12 ordered pairs total.
   All |i−j| = 3 → |i−j|² = 9.
   Normalised probability for each pair = 1/12.
   Contrast = Σ|i−j|² p(i,j) = 12·9·(1/12) = 9.0000

Therefore mean 37.5000, variance 17.3333, skewness 0.0000, kurtosis −0.6003, contrast 9.0000.' config=RadiomicsOutput(mean=37.5, variance=17.3333, skewness=0.0, kurtosis=-0.6003, contrast=9.0)
evaluation_result:
Mean intensity value of the ROI is wrong.
Sample variance of intensity values in the ROI is wrong.
Skewness of intensity distribution in the ROI is correct.
Excess kurtosis of intensity distribution in the ROI is correct.
GLCM contrast feature computed from ROI pixels is correct.
